fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46725].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
* There isn't enough information on [Using Apache to Limit Access to the JIRA Administration Interface|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/using-apache-to-limit-access-to-the-jira-administration-interface-216433009.html] regarding the URLs/URL part group explaining why they are on this list to verify that the URLs/URL parts underwent at least a sanity check.
* The requested format for the URLs/URL parts was chosen to preempt more comments regarding the fact that Atlassian does not support Apache HTTPd configurations.

h3. Suggested Solution
* A comprehensive, unordered list of URLs and URL parts to feed into the configuration of our security product to secure the JIRA administration interface without blocking legitimate access to other parts of JIRA, plus short explanations why a given URL or URL part is included in that list (the list that can be extracted from the article does not fulfill this request; if you need a hostname for the URLs/URL parts, use $HOSTNAME),
fields.summary: Additional infomation request on Using Apache to Limit Access to the JIRA Administration Interface documentation
No error is displayed when assigning to a user whose security doesn't permit the user to see the JIRA record.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46716].
  {panel}

If a workflow has a transition step "Post Function" that automatically assigns a ticket back to a previous person, like this one:

"Assign the issue to the last user from the Developers role who had this issue assigned before"

Then the post function does not "see" any users who have had their username changed. It skips them and moves on to the next user in the list of recently assigned users.

This is repeatable every time. Existing JIRA workflows for transitioning tickets and auto-assigning tickets based on that workflow is effectively broken and it assigns tickets to the wrong person. The most important part to this is that it does so silently. I was only able to figure out it was because of a changed username after a lot of debugging.

Example scenario:

1. Ticket is "In Progress" 
2. Developer transitions the ticket to "In Review" and assigns it to a reviewer
3. The reviewer has some issues with the ticket so they "Reject Review" and the transition post function is supposed to re-assign it back to the developer automatically

Expected Result:
The ticket is assigned to the previous assignee.

Actual Result (for those assignees with changed usernames):
The ticket is assigned to the person that was the assignee before the previous assignee, one person too far up the list.
fields.summary: User does not get assigned ticket during workflow transition if username has been changed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46715].
  {panel}

Inserting a screenshot into a comment results in the following appearing in the comment:

 !image-2015-11-17-08-59-53-045.png|thumbnail! 
Unable to render embedded object: File (WDP-1065 Retest - Website.png) not found.

This started happening in the last 1-2 weeks

Steps to recreate
1) upload a screenshot
2) add a new comment
3) while adding the new comment click the attachment drop down and select a screenshot

This results in the screenshot displaying the above error.

Note: ctrl+v used when adding a screenshot correctly attaches the screenshot to the comment and it renders correctly.
fields.summary: Screenshots in Comments will not render
ddddddddd
zdfzdf
List what custom plugin each transition action is from

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46619].

h5. Definition
Currently when a version is released, there is no easy way to have users notified.

h5. Suggestion
Allow users to be notified on version releases. Ideally it would work as filter subscriptions.
fields.summary: Mail notifications on version release

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46618].
  {panel}

*Feature Summary*
If a user names a field say 'DA' and has lots of other fields that begin with other character but have DA in their name, they would not be able to select the field DA to add as a column in a filter.

This is due to the fact that when adding columns, JIRA sorts the fields in alphabetical order based on their names and should these issues be more than 50 your field DA which doesn't have a unique enough name would not be shown.

_Attached is an imge to explain the sorting and why it could be an issue._

*Suggestion*
Sort fields by those that match the name closest, hence the field DA would show up first before a field which contains characters that from the name.

*Workaround*
- Rename the field to a longer unique name
- Search for the new name when adding the column.
- Add the column.
- Rename the field back to old name if you want it.
_Note that the column would remain however you would need to repeat this each time you want to add the field as a column to other filters or search results._
fields.summary: Allow Column Search Start With Closest Match

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46615].
  {panel}

Problem definition:
As blind user I'm using a screen reader (JAWS). When creating a new jira I can't choose from the list of epics, because the screen reader doesn't read in the list. I'm using a server version of Jira.

Proposed solution:
The epics to appear in a combo-box, it would be much easier to select it.
fields.summary: The screen reader doesn't read the list of epics when create a new issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46614].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
* When re-ordering a sub-tasks one step up or down, this causes the full page to refresh. 
* This issue was not occurring in JIRA 6.4.5 , but it started occurring only after upgrading to JIRA 7. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA 7
# Create an issue
# Create many sub-task 
# Re-order the sub-task ( move the subtask up and down )
!rsz_screenshot_from_2015-11-16_171805.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
* The sub-task should be able to be moved without the whole page refreshing as it works well in JIRA 6.4.5

h3. Actual Results
* The whole page is refresh resulting in the user needing to scroll back to where they were before. It refreshes with every Move button push which makes re-organizing sub-tasks too cumbersome to ever do.
 
h3. Notes
* This issue is related to [JRA-33647 Allow reordering of sub-tasks with drag & drop and without having to reload the page|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-33647] but that ticket did not give enough information and has been closed as duplicate to [JRA-24547 Drag and Drop Subtasks|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-24547] which i believe is entirely different to what is reported in this bug ticket as this issue was not occurring in older versions of JIRA. That ticket is also created as a suggestion and i believe this issue a bug.
fields.summary: Re-ordering (moving) a sub-task one step up or down causes a full page refresh

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46598].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if you upload an image with the same name as the issue key, then JIRA allows you to upload this. However, when you want to insert the image somewhere in your comments, then we are not able to do so as when we type \!issuekey.png|thumbnail!, then the issue key turns to a hyperlink to the issue, instead of rendering the image.

h3. Suggested Solution
Make the wiki renderer render the text in a image tag as an image and disregards any issue key links found. An alternative solution could be to have an escape character that will escape the issue key to be rendered as a hyperlink of that issue. 

h3. Workaround
This is no workaround for this. However, you may still link a image in the comment field using the following method: \[^Issue-Key.png].This would create a link that would open up when clicked on.
fields.summary: As a User, I want to images named as the issue key, to be rendered as images instead of a link to the issue, in the comments
"Create using shared configuration" should have an option to also clone HipChat integration settings
Conection failed after 5 seconds

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46458].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The URL that is suggested for use in JIRA Data Center behind a load balancer, as mentioned in https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ENTERPRISE/JIRA+Data+Center+Load+Balancer+examples states to use {{/status}} and it will return {{"state":"RUNNING"}} for a healthy node that should be in the LB pool.  In my testing, I found that when a node is performing a *foreground re-index* that locks JIRA, it is actually unavailable for processing user requests.  Accessing a node that is performing a locking re-index redirects to an error page and gives an HTTP 503.  When that is occurring, I would not want that node to have user requests routed to it. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Having multiple nodes for JIRA Data Center, we like foreground re-indexing as it is much faster with the amount of data we have.  So when a node is locked for re-indexing we'd like it to take itself out of the pool. This issue is to suggest either:
* the /status page be updated to provide a different status during indexing, possibly {{"state":"INDEXING"}}.  This would allow a LB health check to take the node out of the pool during indexing
* update the Data Center LB documentation (above) to instruct users to use {{/secure/errors.jsp}} as the health check URL as it more accurately conveys whether a node is capable of servicing requests
fields.summary: JIRA Data Center health check status URL doesn't accommodate for foreground indexing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

h3. Problem Definition
Right now, JIRA does not accept ";" to spread users and so, add several users at the same time on the Watchers field.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be nice if JIRA accepted the ";" symbol to separate users and allow the additional of several users at the same time to the Watchers field.
fields.summary: Ability to add multiple users as watcher

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46376].
  {panel}

When I'm navigating to a project via the projects menu, I expect to end up at the issues list for that project.

*Current behaviour:*
- Click on projects menu and subsequently on a project
- sometimes end up at {{/projects/<PROJ>/issues}} views, often end up at {{/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?...}}

*Expected behaviour:*
- Click on projects menu and subsequently on a project
- end up at {{/projects/<PROJ>/issues}} consistently

*Sidenote:*
When visiting a {{/project/<PROJ>/issues}} page, subsequent visits to that project from the Projects menu seem to end up at the issues list for that project.
fields.summary: Project Menu items redirect to Agile/Kanban boards

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46374].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Date picker in JIRA Calendar defaults to previous day

h3. Environment
Cloud JIRA v7.0.0-OD-08-005

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Include the {{Due Date}} field on a ticket screen
# Click the Calendar icon

h3. Expected Results
Calendar should highlight the current date

h3. Actual Results
Calendar highlights the previous day while the current day is in bold text

h3.Workaround
No work around other than selecting the day that is in bold text if the current day is needed.
fields.summary: JIRA Calendar defaults to previous day in date picker

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46371].
  {panel}

1. We were trying to create a workflow yesterday(Nov 09) 
2. Suddenly the following error started appearing whenever we try to access workflows for any project:
"The JIRA server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation."
3. We tried creating a workflow from Project Administration-> Issues->workflows but the workflow is not getting saved
fields.summary: Workflow Error :The JIRA server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46368].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the [SSL for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugin.jirasslplugin] plugin is only compatible with JIRA 7.1 or older versions.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be good for some customers to have this plugin on JIRA 7.2. 

h3. Workaround 
Follow out [Connecting to SSL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/connecting-to-ssl-services-117455.html] guide.
fields.summary: Make SSL for JIRA compatible with JIRA 7.2

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a user has a local avatar (not set in the Atlassian account), and its username changes at some point, the avatar will break:
 !Screen Shot 2019-01-22 at 12.20.20.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Have the username changed (e.g. by a migration).

h3. Expected Results
The avatar won't be affected.

h3. Actual Results
The avatar image breaks.


h3.Workaround

Set an avatar directly in the Atlassian account.

* Profile icon -> *Profile*:
 !Screen Shot 2019-01-22 at 12.25.22.png|thumbnail! 
* Click to change the avatar:
 !Screen Shot 2019-01-22 at 12.25.35.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: User's avatar picture will break if the username changes and if using a local avatar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46365].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The documentation for New line in CSV external import in JIRA doesn't work

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create and save a CSV file as per the documentation *[Importing Data From CSV|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/importing-data-from-csv-185729516.html]* 
{noformat}
Summary, Description, Status
"Login fails", "This is on
a new line", Open
{noformat}
# Do a CSV import in JIRA using the *External Import in JIRA*
# Select "Map Value" option for the field with multiple lines

h3. Expected Results
Issue created to have multiple line in it's _Description_ field.

h3. Actual Results
Imported issue is in one line rather than multiple lines.
{noformat}
"Login fails", "This is ona new line", Open
{noformat}
 
h3.Workaround
Option 1:
- As mentioned in ["this comment" | https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-46365?focusedCommentId=1873212&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-1873212]:
{quote}
 don't hit 'Map Value'. Newlines import fine if you do not select 'Map Value' for that field.
{quote}

Option 2:
It is possible to create newlines by using: {noformat}\\ {noformat} at the beginning of each line as per the example below:
{noformat}
Summary,Type,Description,Status
"next csv new line test","Bug","Atlassian
\\ Testing Issue
\\ Acceptance Criteria
\\ - Line 1
\\ - Line 2
\\ - Line 3
\\ - Line 4",To Do
{noformat}
(!) However, this workaround creates another issue with the exported field as mentioned in this bug ticket: *[JRA-46364|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-46364]*
fields.summary: New line in CSV external import in JIRA doesn't work

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46290].
  {panel}

Current version of JIRA (cloud or server) only use favicon. Unfortunately Apple choose <link rel="mask-icon" ...> for icon rendered inside pinned tabs.

Please add proper configuration for this into JIRA (cloud if possible and server) similar to favicon configuration.

Related info:
https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/documentation/AppleApplications/Reference/SafariWebContent/pinnedTabs/pinnedTabs.html
fields.summary: Add mask-icon for Safari Pinned Tab icon
Screen Templates

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46288].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Linked issue information doesn't displayed in queue list at *Links* column when linking between different JIRA 7 , not in the same instance .

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7
* JIRA Service Desk 3 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Link JIRA A with JIRA B
# Then create a service desk issue at JIRA A , then link with issue at JIRA B
# Create *New Queue* at JIRA Service Desk project at JIRA A . Make sure to display *Link* column.
# Check at the information for earlier issue created . Link issue information should display at the queue , but is not showing.

h3. Expected Results
# Issue information in queue shows *Links* information

h3. Actual Results
# Issue information in queue doesn't shows *Links* information
fields.summary: Linked issue information doesn't displayed in queue list when linking between different JIRA 7

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46287].
  {panel}

We have 4 Jira servers each with over 900 custom fields. And hundreds of projects each with their own customized field configuration. When adding a new custom field to the server it automatically adds these fields to all the field configurations and makes it visible. This makes the field show in the search view, and the excel export view. 

This means that when data is exported from an issue type that should have only 12 fields. the excel file actually has 900 columns in the file making the exported data worthless. Additionally the search only shows 10 or so fields so if you don't know all the available fields it is near impossible to decide which columns you want to show in the search results. or which fields you want to search for. 

We know that we could go in to all the field configurations and hide all the unused fields for all these. However the problem is when a project has a new requirement and adds a new custom field then the field automatically becomes visible in all projects. 

The default behavior should be changed when new fields are added. or at very least allow the person creating the field decide which projects to apply the field to.
fields.summary: Custom Fields are not hidden by default
Problem with images into icons
Custom Issue Collector fields are duplicated

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46283].
  {panel}

I am using JIRA Cloud and noticed that components are sorted by ASCII order, not alphabetical order, when determining the default assignee of a newly created bug. This contradicts the documentation at https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/defining-a-component-185729533.html . That documentation states:

```
If an issue has multiple components, and the default assignees of components clash, the assignee will be set to the default assignee of the component that is first alphabetically.
```

Reproduction steps:

1. Create a component called 'a'
2. Create a component called 'B'
3. Assign Person 1 as the default assignee for component 'a'.
4. Assign Person 2 as the default assignee for component 'B'.
5. Create a new bug that affects both the 'a' and 'B' components.
6. Person 2 is now the assignee for the bug, rather than the expected Person1.
fields.summary: When determining default assignee, components are sorted by ASCII order, not alphabetically as documented.
Ability to disable issue creation/update notification pop-up.
EmailBuilder as part of the JIRA API
Extend GET /rest/api/2/reindex API to indicate that re-index is required

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46278].
  {panel}

*Suggestion Summary*
When a user logs into JIRA for the first time and access a project, the user is shown a set of pop-ups letting them know how to get around JIRA.

*Suggested Feature*
Add a feature to JIRA that allows the JIRA Admin control if they want the pop-up to appear or not as it happens even when a user upgrades JIRA and JIRA has a new feature.
fields.summary: Add a feature that allows admin disable new to project pop-up

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46276].
  {panel}

Suggestion: Add ability to @mention all people in custom User Picker type fields in an issue

We use custom "User Picker" type fields to define 1 working group member from a number of different groups that works on a particular issue. For example, a tech writer, a web developer, a QC, instructional designer, etc. (This is not defined at the project level, but at the issue level). 

When using commenting to @mention we almost always have to look under the "People" area  in the issue and see who all the people are on the issue, and then tag them individually with with @mentions. (Using "watch" is not feasible, it generates far too many emails and is not used, plus, there isn't a separate possibility to simply @mention watchers, now is there?)

Commentary on Atlasssian and the Usefulness of Voting
Of course, I now realize that no matter how many votes a suggestion gets here, it stands about as a great a chance of being implemented in Jira as a flea bench lifting a car, but we have to keep trying, eh? Just look at the top voted issues here, and you'll see the the majority of them have been poo-poo'd by Atlassian. This doesn't build customer confidence in your ability to democratically gather feedback. But there's always a glimmer of hope, after voting for many of the most popular suggestions here, 1 of them actually went into production! Hooray!
fields.summary: @mention people (User Picker fields) on this issue
ffsg

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46274].
  {panel}

h4. Problem
Currently, if administrators install plugins during a peak period, when many users are active on the instance, it may have severe impact on performance and even accessibility of core functionality.

The reason for this partly is having related caches reset globally, which can be a cascade operation, not only affecting the caches related to the very plugin being upgraded, but others dependent on it. This may have the effect of the instance being locked up for 10+ minutes even, depending on the number of active user sessions and the caches affected

h4. Workaround
Based on the facts above, we suggest not to implement major configuration changes during peak-hours. Make sure to schedule such major changes to off-peak hours (overnight or during weekend), when user activity on the instance is minimal.

h4. Proposed solution
One possible solution would be to block/reject incoming user requests during plugin installation/upgrade, to have the impacted period around 30s instead of minutes.
fields.summary: Make hot plugin installation/upgrade less distruptive
Different MS SQL Driver Version Listed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46229].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
If you create a new project using the *Create with shared configuration* as described here:
- [Configuring workflow schemes | https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-workflow-schemes-776636598.html]
- [Defining a project | https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/defining-a-project-776636280.html]

And attempt to SET the Project Key changing it from the automatically generated key on creation as lowercase letters the KEY will show as uppercase in the field but the page will blank out then reset, and not allow you to set the KEY

h3. Environment
* JIRA CLOUD v7.0.0-OD-08-005

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to *Projects* {{https://<INSTANCE>.atlassian.net/secure/BrowseProjects.jspa?selectedCategory=all&selectedProjectType=all}}
# Select *Create New Project*
# Select *Create with shared configuration*
# Choose a Project
# NEXT
# Name It *"Project A"* and the default KEY will be *"PROJ"*
# Change the KEY from *"PROJ"* to *"proj"* or any other KEY Typing In as lowercase
# Submit

h3. Expected Results
Project Created with the Chosen KEY

h3. Actual Results
Fails to Create, Page will blank out, and reset values to default UPPERCASE *"PROJ"* and removes settings for project lead

h3.Workaround
Hold SHIFT or use CapsLock while entering text to the KEY Field
fields.summary: Creating New Project with Create with shared configuration errors when changing KEY using lowercase

fields.description:

  {panel}

1. We were trying to create a workflow yesterday(Nov 09) 
2. Suddenly the following error started appearing whenever we try to access workflows for any project:
"The JIRA server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation."
3. We tried creating a workflow from Project Administration-> Issues->workflows but the workflow is not getting saved
fields.summary: Workflow Error :The JIRA server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46227].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When attempting to move an issue between projects (using the "Move" link in the "More" dropdown on the view issue page), the move will not work; it fails on the first step stating "The issue type selected is invalid".


h3. Steps to Reproduce
* JIRA Cloud
# Start a clean JIRA Cloud with Software and Service Desk
#* Only ‘Epic’ and ‘Story’ are available
#* They’re both in the Default Issue Type Scheme
# Create a Task Management project
# The issue types ‘Task’ and ‘Sub-tasks’ are created
# Moving issues to ‘Task’ Doesn’t work

* JIRA Server
# install JIRA7 software
# create a Business Project of Process Management type (PROCESS)
# create a Software Project of Scrum type (SCRUM)
# create issue in PROCESS, issuetype=Task
# try to move issue above into SCRUM project, issuetype=Bug
# you will get the error attached. Choose SCRUM project, issuetype=Story works fine

h3. Expected Results

The issue is allowed to be moved to the new project with a new issue type.

h3. Actual Results

Moving issues to/from affected types show this error:
{noformat}
The issue type selected is invalid.
{noformat}
 
!JIRA7 Move Error.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes

This is not restricted to the issue types listed here. It can also occur when moving to or from custom issue types.

h3.Workaround

You can try moving issues using the bulk edit feature on the issue search page. Follow the instructions for moving issues in [our knowledge-base article on editing multiple issues at the same time|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACORESERVER072/Editing+multiple+issues+at+the+same+time]

If using bulk edit does not help, you can follow the advice in [this KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Unable+to+move+issue+to+another+Issue+Type+due+to+%27The+issue+type+selected+is+invalid%27+error].

Note: JIRA Cloud users experiencing this issue should open a support ticket at [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com].
fields.summary: Move issue error in JIRA software: 'The issue type selected is invalid'

The JIRA Issue Navigatior Printable View has links that do not work when naturally clicked. They can be used when right-clicked, but this is not a very natural experience. Older JIRA Issues mentioned that this was by-design. 

h3. Suggested Solution

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46219].
  {panel}

Hi Team,

Kindy open a ticket to investigate the below issue. Find that, 2 dimensional gadget filter forgets it filter settings and fall back to user default .. Pls find below for more details


We have discovered what we believe is a 100% repro bug with the actual Atlassian JIRA Gadgets “Issue Statistics” & “Two Dimensional Filter Statistics” gadgets for Dashboards.  Essentially, if you drill-down using the gadgets from the Dashboards (Snip It 1 below - which is surely the intended user path) both gadgets forget their Filters and just enter a basic Search query to return the results.  Thus, each User sees the results in a search and it returns just their local “columns” JIRA settings within their view.  This means the order and fields meant to be displayed by the various Filters driving these gadgets by the creators of the Dashboards at Admin level or User level are lost.  

Also, if you fix it at local level it’s OK provided the User is only accessing one JIRA project on their PC, as if you locally select the correct fields (columns) for one Gadget / Filter, the order then applies to other projects as it’s your local setting, which may not be using the same fields and the Dashboards as they may be showing data for completely different things.  I’ve repro’d this too; Snip It 2 below.

Chris helped isolate the reason being that the drill-down was losing association with the Filter on these 2 gadgets.

As these gadgets are both very useful we will try to raise a request with Atlassian themselves to address; David is doing this.  Just wanted to make you aware in case other teams raise this issue as I spent considerable time trying to resolve as I thought it was something we’d done wrong within our project/dashboards.

If however someone knows another way to ensure Users can see the intended field settings when using these Gadgets, please let us know.

regards

Andy

Snip It 1 (Illustration):  clicking on any of the blue links to drill-down loses the field settings in the search results.

 

Snip It 2 (Illustration):  Drill-down has forgotten the Filter and returned a Search, picking up Users JIRA settings and returning fields not applicable to that specific Filter or Project:


 


Kindly let me know if you need more information on this 

Thanks & Regds

Sandeep Radhakrishnan Warrier
fields.summary: 2 Dimensional gadgets forgets filter settings

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46212].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When the mail handler picks up an email whose sender is from a JIRA user account, that *does not have Create Issue permissions* in said project, it will throw an error and no issue is created:
{code}
WARN [Test] atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-2 ServiceRunner    Test Test[10000]: Reporter (test) does not have permission to create an issue. Message rejected.
{code}
This error obviously makes sense because the user does not have permissions to create issues. But we should allow the option to fall back to using the Default Reporter configured in the mail handler, so theres still an option of creating issues here. 
Technically, the user doesn't have permission to create issues directly in JIRA, but at least have the option of doing it through mail. 

h3. Suggested Solution
A Toggle functionality in the mail handler to choose between:
# Ignore default reporter and prevent issue creation if email is from a user with no Create Issue permission.
# Allow issue to use default reporter and be created in JIRA. 
 
h3. Workaround 
"Trick" jira into thinking these users are anonymous users, (so it will fall back to Default Reporter), e.g. by changing their email addresses in JIRA to a different email. This of course has implications e.g. no notifications can then reach these users.
fields.summary: Toggle between fallback to Default Reporter or preventing issue creation for emails from users with no create issue permission
Provide the ability for Cloud Admins to access application logs
Atlassian Mobile + Firewall

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46202].
  {panel}

we often have more than 1 person working an a task, and we have to create the same task twice, one for each person (or in some cases more than 2).
than problem with that is, some people like to only see tasks assigned to them, and they don't see others involved with those tasks.
when this happens, that person may finish up the task before including others that were supposed to be involved. 
if we can tag other people on the task, then everyone will see who needs to be involved before completing the task solo.
fields.summary: tagging users on sub tasks

none

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46189].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Following instructions to install the Atlassian SDK for centos/red hat does not produce a working installing due to missing files.   


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# go to [install the SDK|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/DOCS/Install+the+Atlassian+SDK+on+a+Linux+or+Mac+System]
# go to Centos/Fedora Yum installation
# enter commands as illustrated.  Once you get to this command:  sudo yum install atlassian-plugin-sdk
Note that it checks for dependencies and resolves that it needs to install 'sdk-installer-5.1.9.rpm' from location [rpm stable|http://sdkrepo.atlassian.com/rpm-stable/]  This step fails with a 404 error.


h3. Expected Results
sudo yum install atlassian-plugin-sdk is able to find and install dependencies


h3. Actual Results
404 error and dependencies are not installed


h3.Workaround
There is no workaround, unable to find required file.
fields.summary: Missing dependency in YUM repo

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46183].
  {panel}

To reproduce:
- send invitation to new user (do not accept invite)
- assign that user to a group giving access to a specific issue
- navigate to the issue
- click on the watchers to add the new user to the watcher's list for the issue

The error message is:
"""
There was an error adding watcher
The user "Paul" does not have permission to view this issue. This user will not be added to the watch list.
"""

An improved message would be

"""
There was an error adding watcher
The user "Paul" has completed registration. This user will not be added to the watch list.
"""

Because of this error I lost a few minutes trying to understand why I could not do the task (of sharing an issue with Paul)
fields.summary: slightly misleading message concerning new user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46168].
  {panel}

When I choose to "Include Sub-Tasks" for the Time Tracking graphical display, the graph is updated, but the "Remaining" number is not changed.

Please note - I am aware that changing the *actual* "Estimate Remaining" amount is another issue, and is being discussed in JRA-1993 - but it would seem to me that expected behaviour for  the toggle button should be to simply change the displayed amount, for a visual reference, just as it does for the graph.

See screenshots attached

h3. *Workaround*

Populating all the estimates correctly, in both the task and in the sub-task will make it work properly.

See the recording:  [^Sub-task time tracking.mp4]
fields.summary: Include Subtasks toggle affects "Time Remaining" graph, but not value

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46156].
  {panel}

This bug is caused by a race condition. 

Steps to reproduce:
Login to JIRA Cloud instance restore a JIRA Backup. Since this is a race condition, we may have to repeat the restore process few times.

In the process of restoring a JIRA backup onto this instance, it had imported the data, it was on the way of disabling/enabling the add-ons, and I hit this stacktrace: https://bitbucket.org/snippets/atlassian/zLr9X

Full log file attached
fields.summary: PICO thread safety race condition on JIRA backup restore in Cloud

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46060].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
On a JIRA screen with tabs, switching to a Custom screen removes the tabs. 

h3. Steps to reproduce : 
# Create a JIRA screen with tabs
# Open the screen 
# The tabs are showing up on the screen.
# Now click on the "Configure Fields" button and select the 'Custom' link 
# As soon as the custom link is selected, the tabs will disappear.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow users to see tabs when using a Custom configuration for fields (e.g. either making them visible by default or providing a checkbox to make tabs visible).

h3. Workaround 
It is possible to configure field visibility for selected users using third party plugins such as the Behaviours functionality from [ScriptRunner for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.onresolve.jira.groovy.groovyrunner]. However, this requires the intervention of a JIRA admin.
fields.summary: As a User, I'd like to see tabs when using a Custom configuration for fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46059].
  {panel}

I try moving a bug from my (ICER) project to my (IPRO) project and it fails saying bug does not exist in IPRO ... (see attachment MoveFails)

Appears that the management commands are using the Default Issue Type Scheme rather than the assigned Issue Type Scheme For Development Project (see attachment ScreenSchemes and DefaultIssueTypeScheme)

The assigned scheme has all issue types (bug, task, new feature, improvement, and sub-task)
The default scheme does not have bug in it though the attachment shows bug struck through in the dropdown? and no way to add bug?

I can create bugs to my hearts content but if I need to move them I can't since it doesn't appear to recognize bug as legitimate ...
fields.summary: Unable to move bug between projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46058].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently it's not possible to update user's timezone using the API method {{PUT /rest/api/2/user}} as it only allows updating the username, display name and email address.
h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an option to update the timezone as well.
fields.summary: Update user's timezone using REST

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46057].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The page crashes when we want to change the columns displayed for a list of issues.

h3. Environment
JIRA Agile v7.1.2-D20151028T015626 using IE.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click on Issues > Search for issues;
# Add or remove column.

h3. Expected Results
Be able to add or remove columns.

h3. Actual Results
Internet Explorer has stopped working.
'A problem caused the program to stop working correctly. Please close the program.'
 
h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3.Workaround
Use a different browser.
fields.summary: The page crashes when I want to change the columns displayed for a list of issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46056].
  {panel}

*Problem Definition*

Currently the gadgets font is very small and the created-vs-resolved diagram has a white background color (this does not match the white-on-black overall layout).

*Suggested Solution*

Make the gadgets display the same colour or allow users to set the colour.

*Workaround*

Currently there is no workaround for this issue
fields.summary: Improve Wallboard Gadget Look

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46054].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently it is not possible to paste copied cells into JIRA issue without them using screenshots
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow copy and pasting from excel to JIRA and maintaining their format as in excel
fields.summary: copy excel cells without sending the screenshot jira task

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-46053].
  {panel}

*Problem Definition*

Currently in JIRA if user would like to change the *Priority* icon, user will have to type the directory of icon manually and there will not be a thumbnail preview for the icons selected.

*Suggested Solution*

Allow JIRA to select icons for *Priority* in similar manner as the *Issue* icon. User would like to have a UI in JIRA where they can navigate to the location of the icon and see the preview of icon before applying changes.

Replace the current way of changing priority icon as shown here  !Edit Priority   Test JIRA.png|thumbnail!  and replace it with something similar as the way to replace Issue Type icon as shown here  !Select Issue Type Avatar   Test JIRA.png|thumbnail! .

*Workaround*

Currently user will have to type the icon directory manually and apply the change to view the icon.
fields.summary: Select Priority icon in UI method
